Author: Fiza Shahid
Published Date: 2025-10-30T14:20:18.000Z
URL: https://www.clustox.com/blog/mood-tracker-apps/
Text: Some days feel like youâ€™re riding a rollercoaster with no seatbelt. One moment youâ€™re on top of the world, the next youâ€™re stuck in a gloomy loop.

Mood tracker apps can act like little sidekicks, helping you map your emotional ups and downs. They show patterns, reveal triggers, and even help you celebrate the small wins when your mood improves. Think of them as your personal weather app, but for your feelings.

Taking care of your mental health is more important than ever. The [World Health Organization (WHO) estimates](https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/9789240049338) that around one in eight people worldwide is living with a mental disorder. Using a mood tracker can be a simple way to spot patterns, manage stress, and take little steps to feel better each day.

URL: https://mood-tracker.net/
Text: Best Mood Tracker Apps of 2025
# Best Mood Tracker Apps of 2025
Discover the best apps to support your mental health and emotional well-being
Last updated: October 15, 2025
## What is a Mood Tracker?
Mood trackers are essential tools for monitoring and improving emotional well-being. By using a mood tracker app, you can track your daily emotions, identify patterns, and make adjustments to enhance your overall mental health. In this list, we present the top 10 mood tracker apps of 2025 to help you find the perfect tool to support your emotional well-being.
## Moodistory
#1![App Icon](moodistory/app-icon1.png)
Moodistory is an app that helps you keep track of your moods and feelings. It's easy to use and has a cool design. You can see patterns in your mood over time and understand why you might feel a certain way. It's a great tool for taking care of your mental health.

Text: # Bearable vs Daylio, which one should you choose?

- [November 25, 2020](https://bearable.app/2020/11/25/)

I admit it, Iâ€™m obsessed with mood tracker apps. This became blatantly obvious during the pandemic as I had more time on my hands and too many emotions to juggle. Because I was spending basically all my time at home I could pay better attention to my habits, moods, or any symptoms that came up.

Iâ€™m someone who is very careful about my lifestyle choices. In the past, I have dealt with depression and I never want to feel as dark as I once did. I accept that due to my chemical makeup I need to be more cautious about my routine than other people.
